alert.note: Alert for Harrison (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 6:48AM CST until February 06 at 7:30AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana...Mississippi... Tangipahoa River Near Robert affecting Tangipahoa Parish. Biloxi River Near Lyman affecting Harrison County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi... West Hobolochitto Creek Near McNeill affecting Pearl River County. Wolf River Above Gulfport affecting Harrison County. For the Tangipahoa River...including Osyka, Kentwood, Amite, Robert...Minor flooding is forecast. For the West Hobolochitto Creek...including McNeill...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Wolf River...including Landon, Gulfport...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Biloxi River...including Wortham, Lyman...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wolf River Above Gulfport. * WHEN...From late tonight to Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Bells Ferry Road will begin to flood. There will be water over the access road just upstream of the bridge and the road will become impassable very quickly. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM CST this morning the stage was 6.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 8.5 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.5 feet on 01/14/1992. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
